column2: IPA: [ˈvʲixərʲɪfkə]) is a town in Bratsky District of Irkutsk Oblast
column4: located on the left bank of the Vikhorevka River (Angara River's tributary)
column6: the administrative center of the oblast
column7: and 46 kilometers (29 mi) southwest of Bratsk. Population: 22

column1: It was founded in 1957 as a workers' settlement due to the construction of the western section of the Baikal–Amur Mainline between Tayshet and Bratsk. The river
column3: and the town were named after Vikhor Savin
column4: a Strelets sotnik who was killed here by the Tungus people in 1630. It was granted town status in 1966.

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Vikhorevka is subordinated to Bratsky District. As a municipal division
column3: the town of Vikhorevka is incorporated within Bratsky Municipal District as Vikhorevskoye Urban Settlement.

column1: The town's economy relies mainly on timber production
column2: as well as a railway depot.
